demos.name: Five Levels of Care
demos.description: Jastr’s quantified model across five levels of care takes on an intuitive and logical step towards understanding how to enable holistic diagnostic differentials on a breakthrough platform. The platform creates a new approach to integrated health, interoperability, relational architecture, and portability while fine-tuning and advancing personalization at the consumer level.

screens.home:
Drive User Storage

Jastr uses quantified data and visualization to encourage users to get the most of the 5LoC platform by increasing input of health data across all levels. We also enable easy discovery tools through search and navigation that has not been achieved.
screens.tab0:
Disruptive Value Network

The binary care level not only pushes forward digital health but also aims to securely enable digital health to move from a disruptive innovation towards a sustaining innovation. Jastr’s platform is the disruptive value network that will put consumer technologies on the same playing field as incumbent services.
screens.tab1:
Steer Mobile-First Thinking

Poor incentives drive primary care providers in a brick and mortar setting to become increasingly specialized; this is no different than the current obsession with specialties (the wrong direction). Instead, Jastr’s primary care level advances their ability to shift towards a mobile-first solution in order to drive down costs and in- crease consumer value in the right direction.
screens.tab2:
Codify the Non-Obvious

Jastr’s secondary level of care meets the non-obvious need to have leaders who understand the need for organization, pragmatic design, and clarity. While incumbents argue about politically correct scope of care, Jastr will build technology to let consumers drive usability and clear up the blurred lines between health services.
screens.tab3:
Defy Market Trends

By virtue of making tertiary care health products and services available to all consumers, Jastr aims to go against current market trends of high costs affiliated with specialization and poor incentives driven by medical marketing. Instead, Jastr’s model enables integrated care across all levels, a logical step towards clinically invasive processes, and definition despite complexity of tertiary products and services.
screens.tab4:
Democratize Innovation

Innovation is all around us, sometimes, it is not just well dispersed. Jastr’s vision for quaternary care is to not only enable more access to what makes our health care system so innovative but also, push the experimental, clinical, and innovative to move with cloud computing technologies and Jastr’s platform lens.
screens.end:
Quantify Health Status

Truly aligned incentives starts with a platform that never compromises on data-driven outcomes. Lack of due diligence from health organizations to reimagine data value is solved by consumer en- gagement. Appropriation of health is solved by in- stant deduction of over- use and underuse of health services on a per- sonalized level. Lucid nu- merical thresholds can drive problems of trans- parency and compliant behavior. And signs of negligence can be as- sessed at the forefront of basic communication messaging.

demos.name: Value Based Health
demos.description: Jastr’s vision is to move health and medicine away from being a practice and more into data-driven field of science. At the core of any product or service is the choice for weighing value—ergo, this is where we’ll build a core algorithmic and machine learning competency. The ability to define value through both qualitative and quantitative terms is a feat not too many startups are chasing and is neither one that is being used to drive consumer-driven choices by incumbents. We choose to deliver and create value through this disconnect.

screens.screen1:
Designing Symbolic Systems

Mathematics is considered a universal language—at Jastr, we believe technology can help connect symbols in health the way the at- sign, the ampersand, and the percent sign have become functional objects in code as well as a functional com- mands by consumers (E.g. @Twitter, %space, /percent). One way to have stakeholders speak the same language is to design ways to mutually identify with the same symbols through the same functional design.
screens.screen2:
Crowdsource, Index, and Repeat

Transparency, ranking, and indexing quality of products and services are not mutually exclusive in search engines on the web so why are they in health? Because for a long time, lack of transparency was a tool to drive profitability. The only way to enable a defined contribution for value amongst health stakeholders is to rebuild those databases from scratch.
screens.screen3:
Intersecting Qualitative & Quantitative Value

Value is diminished by ill incentives, cognitive biases, and social constructs. Jastr will bring objectivity, logic, and reason to empower the consumer to choose outcomes that matter defines value at the intersection of cost, quality, and access.
screens.screen7:
Personalizing Health Choices

Personal health data preferences are our bottom-up approach to redefining value and consumer driven outcomes. Unlike other stakeholders, Jastr aims to earn user trust by enabling their preferences to drive our personalization, analytics, and backend systems.
screens.screen8:
Data-Driven Decision-Making

Personal health data preferences are our bottom-up approach to redefining value and consumer driven outcomes. Unlike other stakeholders, Jastr aims to earn user trust by enabling their preferences to drive our personalization, analytics, and backend systems.
screens.screen9:
Primary & Secondary Roles

Changing the patient provider relationship is about changing the dialogue through an empowered consumer. Jastr’s vision is to develop the consumer into their primary resource and their provider as secondary- this subtle change will advance the economics of health in favor of more supporting roles, enabled by technology.
screens.screen10:
Financial Health Management

Payments in health have yet to be affected by cost-cutting technologies and innovation—while the cost of care has increased significantly. Jastr believes that the turn towards managed health will only be advanced when the flexibility of transactions can match.

demos.name: High Deductable Insurance - Health Savings Account
demos.description: The difference between Jastr and many digital health platform compa- nies is where we believe stakehold- ers ought to be bullish. When it comes to partnering with financial health partnerships. Like PayPal, Venmo, and Square: Jastr will allow for health payments to be done through the Internet and not paper based checks or slow reimbursement approvals; we will enable reoccurring transaction management and data portability –building new hardware and software to allow consumers to drive low-cost transactions and pro- active interaction to incumbent stakeholders.

screens.home: Jastr makes it easy to configure your health plan through a step-by-step process, prompting users to be active in not only digital health informatics, but also: the future of health insurance, actuarial sciences, and risk management.
screens.screen1: Jastr uses quantified metrics to usher users to be cognizant of integration of their health plan, to simplify analytics for health risk, as well as to employ optical character recognition if they want to give us all their data to clean. consumer level.
screens.screen2: Cost consciousness starts with knowing how much funding is available across all health allocations. Jastr makes it easy to maintain visibility and awareness through financial health visualizations and account management.
screens.screen3: Jastr makes it easy for consumers to see how each financial resource covers their health plan across mediums – enabling more people to fear less the cost of health. Instead, Jastr’s technology advocates for managed health, cost-effectiveness, and interoperability and portability across mediums.
screens.screen4: Jastr defines risk at the intersection of one’s genetics/genomics, location/environment al factors, and personal habits. By breaking down risk into coherent risk factors, consumers will be able to take more control of their circumstance.
screens.screen5: Based on those intersections, Jastr provides actionable recommendations actions to offset said risks through an anonymized cloud database that aggregates data from similar persona accounts and health profiles.
screens.screen6: Anonymized transactions make it easy to predict how users spend their funds to manage health while creating consumer trends.
screens.screen7: Consumers are almost never able to see costs before they enter a health care organization for themselves, let along others’ transactions. Jastr uses anonymized data to make transparent direct costs, insurance coverage, health savings eligibility, or other sources.
screens.screen8: Jastr makes it easy to uncover all possible transactions, products, and services within purchasing trends and data. Consumers only have to press on simplified design sections to branch out more information for access to options.
screens.screen9: Health insurance can disrupt itself by allowing Jastr to build new bundled plans that meld hardware, software, and health biologics that frame behavior as the medium. Bundled health plans that include digital objects allows for consumer compliance, transparency, and a long-term sustainability.
screens.screen10: Consumers care about their health – but they care just as much as how much or how little they spend or save. Cost consciousness and bundled health plans is the future of insurance. With the advent of the Affordable Care Act and skyrocketing plan costs – there is no more of an ideal time to test new compliance models at the intersection of technology and the health sciences.
screens.screen11: Jastr makes it easy to enable disease centric bundled health plans through the flip of a switch- allowing consumers to navigate through options that match their incentivized behaviors without needing to invest in understanding the complexities of health insurance and health industry practices.

demos.name: Search and Rank
demos.description: The advance of innovation is not only dependent on the ability to find new value in basic science and core technologies but also in application of rules, code, and design into other fields. The advent of digital health is in part new market innovation as well as creatively merging other industry practices. Jastr aims to take the power of search and rank to help democratize innovation found in quaternary care levels.

screens.home:
Proactive Health

Discovery starts with access—and Jastr aims to democratize access of new experimental, clinically invasive, and DIY products and services. The idea of 5P Health and Medicine will only come to fruition when it is driven by consumer query, search, and predictive trends.
screens.screen1:
Conditional Risk Aversion

Discovery starts with access—and Jastr aims to democratize access of new experimental, clinically invasive, and DIY products and services. The idea of 5P Health and Medicine will only come to fruition when it is driven by consumer query, search, and predictive trends.
screens.screen2:
Democratizing Clinical Trials

Jastr makes it easy to find all levels of drug therapeutics through search, rank, and social algorithms that make personalized health and scientific communities a dualistic package. Consumers will be able to access new databases across Clinical Phase I-IV to follow from the earliest to latest of stages.
screens.screen3:
Forward Thinking Personalization

Jastr will not only make ranking systems automatic but also, we’ll enable the power of social search, personalization suggestions, and run algorithms based on one’s profile from personal health data from our backend systems.
screens.screen4:
Secure Consultations

Unlike the current providers’ role, suppliers already have an incentive for direct-to-consumer assistance; Jastr makes that experience seamless and uncomplicated by enable consumers to have transparent information and for suppliers to know whom they are working with without the complications of medicinal marketing regulation.
screens.screen5:
Multi-touch Usability

Users can enable access to multiple levels of clinical trials based on their own risk aversion. Jastr’s system makes it possible to analyze public interest in scientific discovery in accordance to their health status – making it possible to increase participatory science and enable users from across regions to collaborate based on their personalized health profiles.
screens.screen6:
Digital Health is Social

Jastr will not only make social search inherent in our algorithms based on search history but also through similar health profiles. By virtue of enabling cohorts of similar genetic profiles to enter clinical trials, Jastr will push forward discovery. Rather than deployments of hundred million dollar funds, scientific discovery will build personalized therapeutics for small pools of personnel.
screens.screen7:
Value-Based Care

Jastr’s model for value-based care is applicable on all levels of care, as well as the embedded experiences we create. Clinical trials will be ranked and valued based on the same meta platform but further adjusted when a consumer enters this service.
screens.screen8:
Managed Financials

Payments are enabled because insurance is a barrier to clinical trials – they usually never cover experimental clinical trials and if a consumer consumes experimental procedures when they are gambling for life and death, that cost is usually never pre-planned or broken down into reoccurring figures. Jastr will help aggregate health plans based on payment method preferences.
